meanings.definition: A mark made to ensure proper alignment or matching of parts.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a matchmark to align the pieces of wood perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The matchmark on the puzzle piece helped me connect it to the right spot.
meanings.sent3: The matchmark on the map was a smiley face, making navigation more fun.
meanings.sent4: Her bright red matchmark stood out among the sea of black dots on the document.
meanings.sent5: The matchmark on the blueprint was like a secret code, guiding the construction workers.

meanings.definition: To mark with a distinctive symbol for identification or alignment.
meanings.sent1: Please matchmark each box with a number for easy identification.
meanings.sent2: The tailor will matchmark the fabric before cutting it for the dress.
meanings.sent3: He decided to matchmark his tools with tiny stickers to add some flair.
meanings.sent4: The artist matchmarked her paintings with a small star in the corner.
meanings.sent5: The chef would matchmark each plate with a unique garnish before serving.
